name: hardening
content:
hardening noun [U or S]
(BECOMING HARD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of becoming or making something hard: Excess calcium can accelerate hardening of the arteries. The skin disorder is characterized by a hardening of skin around the hair follicles.
More examplesFewer examplesThe X-ray showed an irregular hardening of the bone.Subcutaneous tissue showed expansion and hardening.They cut cake flour into the cookie dough for a more tender crumb, preventing too much hardening upon cooling.

hardening noun [U or S]
(BECOMING SEVERE)
the act of becoming more severe, determined, or unpleasant: There has been a hardening of government policy since the invasion. His remarks represented a hardening of his position from his more moderate initial response.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter 1974 there was a hardening of attitudes in the West against the intentions of the USSR.Among the anti-whaling nations, there was a noticeable hardening of stance.An effortless hardening had taken place in his tone.
